p: The study site was located in Longchuan County (24°08′–24°39′ N, 97°17′–97°39′ E), in the western end of Yunnan Province, Southwest China. This area is characterized by a typical tropical climate, having a rainy season featuring heavy rainfall with 90 % relative humidity alternating with a dry season [ 30]. Rainfall averages 15450 mm per year and the annual mean temperature is 18.9 °C. Recently, the range of M. micrantha has been expanding rapidly within Longchuan County, as the plant has invaded agricultural areas and forest margins [ 7].
